name: Isomorphism
summary:
In mathematics, an isomorphism is a structure-preserving mapping or morphism between two structures of the same type that can be reversed by an inverse mapping. Two mathematical structures are isomorphic if an isomorphism exists between them, and this is often denoted as ⁠
  
    
      
        A
        ≅
        B
      
    
    {\displaystyle A\cong B}
  
⁠. The word is derived from Ancient Greek  ἴσος (isos) 'equal' and  μορφή (morphe) 'form, shape'.
